newsitem.title: USA: Sears to donate $1 million for retailing center.
newsitem.headline: Sears to donate $1 million for retailing center.

text.p: Sears, Roebuck and Co. said Wednesday it will donate more than $1 million to establish the Centre of Education and Research in Retailing at the Indiana University School of Business.

Sears said the new centre, the first it has ever endowed as a founding sponsor, is designed to stimulate interest in retailing and sponsor research projects in this area. The centre also will help faculty develop state-of-the-art materials and teaching methods, Sears added.
"It's a natural fit for Sears and Indiana, both being in the Midwest," Bob Wery, director of college relations for Sears, said by telephone.
He added Indiana University has a strong reputation in business education, ranked highly for graduate and undergraduate programmes.

"Retailing has a long tradition of excellence at Indiana University, but the increased sophisticaton of retail management makes it imperative that business schools develop closer ties to the industry," Dan Dalton, interim dean of the Indiana University School of Business, said in a statement.
Sears, the nation's second largest retailer with annual revenues of more than $34.0 billion, said the new centre at Indiana University also may help recruitment efforts for it and other store chains.
The donation will be made over coming years.
